page.title: 17Cattle Market in Banbury (4)
page.content: There are eight or nine auctioneers. On Wednesdays they sell about 400 calves, 100 cows, 1,500 store cattle and 100 dairy cows. They also sell young pigs. On Thursdays they sell for meat. They sell about 1,000 fat cattle, 400 fat cows, 1,000 fat pigs and 4,000 fat sheep. They sell about 1,500,000 pounds worth of stock every week. The most unusual animal that was sold was a bison. The most expensive animal was a Charolais cross steer. It fetched 13,000 pounds. Midland Marts got 260 and the farmer got 12,740. Most of the cattle comes from a fifty mile radius around Banbury. Here are some of the auctioneers' language terms: "Stand-on","Maiden Bid" and "Been here all night".
